smell_analysis.justification: All diagram pages provided contain visible model elements and are not empty.

All use cases are associated with actors. The use case 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid' (Page 3) is connected via <<include>> relationships to use cases that are directly connected to the 'Autode haldur' actor, establishing a valid association.
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found. Use case names are distinct and specific (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki autosid' vs 'Vaata kõiki ootel...').

No distinct model elements with the same name were found within the same package. Elements like 'Klassifikaator' appearing in multiple diagrams are references to the same class in the 'Klassifikaatorite register' package.

No redundant data value storage was found. Shared column names like 'nimetus' (Name) or 'reg_aeg' (Registration Time) in tables like 'Auto', 'Riik', and 'Isik' represent distinct attributes for different entities, not denormalization.
All use cases consistently start with a verb in the imperative form (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda', 'Lõpeta').
In the State Diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable from the 'Algus' state via valid transitions.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions and decisions form a connected flow reachable from the Start node.
All visible associations on class and database diagrams (e.g., Page 5, 12, 14, 17) have multiplicity indicators explicitly defined at both ends (e.g., '1' and '0..*').
No diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The largest diagram (Page 15, Klassifikaatorite register) contains exactly 9 tables.
No single element has 6 or more visual connections on a single diagram. The most connected element is 'Isik' on Page 6 with 5 connections (2 inheritance, 3 associations).
The layout of all diagrams is balanced, with no related elements placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali'). 'Algus' in the activity diagram is a label for the start node, not an action name.
All class, table, attribute, and use case names are longer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto').
All class names are capitalized and singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').
All attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_number').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto', 'Tootaja_roll').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes were found in element names. Prefixes like 'PK_' and 'FK_' in database diagrams are part of the constraint labels, not the column names themselves.
